metadata.Title: CVE-2020-36242 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the cryptography package before 3.3.2 for Python, certain sequences ofupdate calls to symmetrically encrypt multi-GB values could result in aninteger overflow and buffer overflow, as demonstrated by the Fernet class.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36242` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-cryptography - 2.1.4-1ubuntu1.4
python3-cryptography - 2.1.4-1ubuntu1.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-cryptography package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.4-1ubuntu1.4').
